newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Austrian shares close off, seen edgy on CA sale.
newsitem.headline: Austrian shares close off, seen edgy on CA sale.

text.p: Austrian shares tumbled on Thursday after a volatile day overshadowed by the looming sale of the state's stake in flagship bank Creditanstalt and traders said the outlook remained uncertain.
The ATX index of 21 blue chips ended 7.06 points or 0.62 points lower at 1,130.22. Among its constituents 16 ATX shares fell and five rose.
Traders said the index was well-supported at 1,130, but could test 1,120 points if it slipped below that level.
Creditanstalt preference shares fell one percent after the bank reported a 20 percent rise in its preliminary 1996 net profit.
"The market slipped after the Creditanstalt results, which weighed heavily on the mood," one trader said.
EA-Generali, leading a consortium of bidders for Creditanstalt, whose chances of success are seen as increasingly slim, topped the day's decliners, falling 3.23 percent to 3,000 schillings.
But traders saw potential for a recovery due to a lack of sellers on the market and strong technical support at the current level.
The January ATX future dropped 6.8 points to 1,129.7.
The broad-based Vienna Bourse index shed 2.07 points or 0.48 percent to 425.56. -- Vienna newsroom +431 53112 257
